title: Composite integration layer
summary: A thin layer that composes data from multiple domains to serve external partner/API needs without coupling domains together.

decisionGuidance.problemSolved: External systems often require joined views; doing joins inside domains forces shared models.
whenNotToUse: A single domain can own the complete response end-to-end

gotchas: Composite layer becomes a new monolith
thingsToWatchOutFor.opinionatedGuidance: Keep it thin and contract-driven; prefer event-driven read models when possible.

complexity.rationale: Composition is powerful but needs careful governance.
complexity.skillDemand: API composition + distributed systems design skill.

realWorldExample.approach: Built a composite integration endpoint powered by domain events.
realWorldExample.outcome: Reduced cross-domain coupling while meeting partner needs.
